philosophy: Metrics are cognition-first, exam-agnostic, and graph-derived. Each metric maps to multiple ReasoningStep nodes and avoids semantic overlap with others.

metrics.description: Measures the ability to draw correct implicit conclusions from text, including logical deduction and identification of unstated assumptions.
metrics.mapping_logic: Aggregates performance on reasoning steps involving inference, deduction, assumption identification, and author-intent alignment.

metrics.description: Evaluates the ability to analyze argumentative structure, including identifying premises, conclusions, and logical dependencies.
metrics.mapping_logic: Combines scores from reasoning steps focused on premise identification, conclusion validation, and argument evaluation.

metrics.description: Assesses the ability to recognize and avoid common CAT VARC traps such as extreme language, opposites, scope shifts, and distortions.
metrics.mapping_logic: Incorporates failures and successes linked to error-pattern nodes like extreme-option trap, scope trap, and distortion trap.

metrics.description: Measures how effectively a user eliminates incorrect options to converge on the correct answer, independent of direct inference.
metrics.mapping_logic: Tracks the correctness and quality of eliminated options relative to known trap patterns and valid eliminations.

metrics.description: Evaluates the appropriateness and sequencing of strategies applied while solving a question.
metrics.mapping_logic: Combines reasoning steps related to strategy selection, execution order, and alignment with question intent.

metrics.description: Assesses the ability to balance attention between local details and global structure such as main idea, theme, and logical flow.
metrics.mapping_logic: Aggregates performance on reasoning steps involving main idea tracking, supporting detail evaluation, and structural coherence.

metrics.description: Measures sensitivity to author tone, attitude, and communicative intent.
metrics.mapping_logic: Incorporates reasoning steps related to tone detection, intent inference, and attitude-based elimination.

metrics.description: Evaluates the ability to assess relevance, sufficiency, and strength of evidence supporting claims or conclusions.
metrics.mapping_logic: Combines reasoning steps that involve validating evidence, rejecting weak support, and distinguishing correlation from causation.

metrics.description: Measures the stability of reasoning accuracy under increasing time pressure, especially toward the latter part of a session.
metrics.mapping_logic: Analyzes accuracy decay, error-pattern frequency, and rushed reasoning steps as time spent per question increases.

metrics.description: Measures effective reading speed in words per minute without regard to correctness.
metrics.mapping_logic: Calculated using passage word count and time spent before first interaction with questions, normalized across sessions.
